oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of nominal substitution of transition metals for excess Fe in Fe1+xSe superconductor
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: YADAV, AK
SANCHELA, AV
THAKUR, AD
TOMY, CV
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CRITICAL FIELD
Iron Chalcogenicle
Substitution
Chemical pressure
Thermopower
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Taking cue from the increase in the superconducting transition temperature (T-c) of Fe1 + xSe via nominal (2 wt%) substitution or Cr instead or excess Fe, we have now extended our study with nominal substitution (<= 5 wt%) with other transition metals (Ni, Co, Fe, Mn, Cr, V and Ti) in place or excess iron. The T-c is round to increase (maximum similar to 11 K) or get suppressed depending on the substituted transition metal. Our studies indicate that the superconducting transition temperature depends on ionic size or the transition metal and amount or hexagonal phase present as impurity. (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
